intro: Banisteria campestris var. rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf banisteria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent, spurred calyx, contributing to its ornamental value. This variety is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in partial to full sunlight.
